name: Ampharos
flavorText: The tail's tip shines brightly and can be seen from far away. It acts as a beacon for lost people.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Azumarill
flavorText: By keeping still and listening intently, it can tell what is in even wild, fast-moving rivers.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Bellossom
flavorText: Plentiful in the tropics. When it dances, its petals rub together and make a pleasant ringing sound.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove all damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Does 30 damage times the number of cards with Bellossom in their names that you have in play (including this one).

name: Feraligatr
flavorText: When it bites with its massive and powerful jaws, it shakes its head and savagely tears its victim up.
Ability1Text: When you play Feraligatr from your hand, flip a coin. If heads, discard the top 5 cards from your opponent's deck. If tails, discard the top 5 cards from your deck.
Attack1Text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of damage counters on Feraligatr. This attack does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

name: Feraligatr
flavorText: It is hard for it to support its own weight out of water, so it gets down on all fours. But it moves fast.
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Water Energy card from your hand. This power can't be used if Feraligatr is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage plus 10 damage times the number of Water Energy cards in your discard pile. Then, shuffle all Water Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.

name: Heracross
flavorText: This powerful Pokémon thrusts its prized horn under its enemies' bellies, then lifts and throws them.
Ability1Text: If Heracross's remaining HP are 20 or less, you may make its Megahorn attack's base damage 120 instead of 60. This power can't be used if Heracross is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Jumpluff
flavorText: Once it catches the wind, it deftly controls its cotton-puff spores to float, even around the world.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: If this attack damages the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), remove 1 damage counter from Jumpluff, if it has any.

name: Kingdra
flavorText: It is said that it usually hides in underwater caves. It can create whirlpools by yawning.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Kingdra.
Attack2Text: If this attack doesn't Knock Out the Defending Pokémon, and if there are any Pokémon on your opponent's Bench, choose 1 of them and switch it with the Defending Pokémon.

name: Lugia
flavorText: It is said that it quietly spends its time deep at the bottom of the sea, because its powers are too strong.
Attack1Text: Discard a Fire Energy card, a Water Energy card, and a Lightning Energy card attached to Lugia in order to use this attack.

name: Meganium
flavorText: Meganium's breath has the power to revive dead grass and plants. It can make them healthy again.
Ability1Text: When you play Meganium from your hand, you may flip a coin. If heads, remove all damage counters from all Grass Pokémon in play.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Meganium
flavorText: The aroma that rises from its petals contains a substance that calms aggressive feelings.
Ability1Text: As long as Meganium is in play each Grass Energy card attached to your Grass Pokémon instead provides GrassGrass. This power stops working while Meganium is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Pichu
flavorText: Despite its small size, it can zap even adult humans. However, if it does so, it also surprises itself.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon in play that has a Pokémon Power. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

name: Skarmory
flavorText: Its sturdy wings look heavy, but they are actually hollow and light, allowing it to fly freely in the sky.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, all damage done by attacks to Skarmory during your opponent's next turn is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Slowking
flavorText: When its head was bitten, toxins entered Slowpoke's head and unlocked an extraordinary power.
Ability1Text: Whenever your opponent plays a Trainer card, you may flip a coin. If heads, that card does nothing. Put it on top of your opponent's deck. This power can't be used if Slowking is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, this attack does 20 damage.

name: Steelix
flavorText: Its body has been compressed deep under the ground. As a result, it is even harder than a diamond.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage.

name: Togetic
flavorText: They say that it will appear before kindhearted, caring people and shower them with happiness.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose an attack on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Super Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy cost. (You must still do anything else in order to use that attack.) (No matter what type the Defending Pokémon is, Togetic's type is still Colorless.) Togetic performs that attack. (Togetic can make that attack even if it does not have the appropriate number or type of Energy attached to it necessary to make the attack.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Togetic; if tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

name: Typhlosion
flavorText: If its rage peaks, it becomes so hot that anything that touches it will instantly go up in flames.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Fire Pokémon. This power can't be used if Typhlosion is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage and does 20 damage to Typhlosion. If tails, this attack does 60 damage.

name: Typhlosion
flavorText: It has a secret, devastating move. It rubs its blazing fur together to cause huge explosions.
Ability1Text: When you play Typhlosion from your hand, you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for up to 4 Fire Energy cards and attach them to Typhlosion. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack1Text: Discard 3 Fire Energy cards attached to Typhlosion in order to use this attack. Do 20 damage to each Benched Pokémon (yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Cleffa
flavorText: Because of its unusual, star-like silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.
Attack1Text: Shuffle your hand into your deck, then draw 7 cards.

name: Donphan
flavorText: It has sharp, hard tusks and a rugged hide. Its tackle is strong enough to knock down a house.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Donphan.
Attack2Text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with his or her Active Pokémon, then, if you have any Benched Pokémon, you switch 1 of them with your Active Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

name: Elekid
flavorText: It rotates its arms to generate electricity, but it tires easily, so it charges up only a little bit.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, do 20 damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon. (Apply Weakness and Resistance.) Either way, this ends your turn. This power can't be used if Elekid is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

name: Magby
flavorText: Each and every time it inhales and exhales, hot embers dribble out of its mouth and nostrils.
Attack1Text: All Pokémon Powers stop working until the end of your next turn.

name: Murkrow
flavorText: It is said that when chased, it lures its attacker onto dark mountain trails where the foe will get lost.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat as long as Murkrow remains your Active Pokémon. (Benching or evolving either Pokémon ends this effect.)
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Pokémon Powers, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

name: Sneasel
flavorText: Its paws conceal sharp claws. If attacked, it suddenly extends the claws and startles its enemy.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin for each of your Pokémon in play (including this one). This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Aipom
flavorText: Its tail is so powerful that it can use it to grab a tree branch and hold itself up in the air.
Attack1Text: Shuffle Aipom and all cards attached to it into your deck. Flip a coin. If heads, shuffle a card from your discard pile into your deck.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Ariados
flavorText: It spins string not only from its rear but also from its mouth. It's hard to tell which end is which.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat. (Benching or evolving that Pokémon ends this effect.)
Attack2Text: If this attack damages the Defending Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and you remove a number of damage counters from Ariados equal to half that damage (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Ariados has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

name: Bayleef
flavorText: A spicy aroma emanates from around its neck. The aroma acts as a stimulant to restore health.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, Bayleef can't become Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. (All other effects of attacks, Pokémon Powers and Trainer cards still happen.)

name: Bayleef
flavorText: The scent of spices comes from around its neck. Somehow, sniffing it makes you want to fight.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads and if any of your Pokémon have any damage counters on them, then remove 2 damage counters from 1 of them (or 1 if it only has 1). If tails and if any of your opponent's Pokémon have any damage counters on them, choose 1 of them and remove 2 damage counters from it (or 1 if it only has 1).
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

name: Clefairy
flavorText: The moonlight that it stores in the wings on its back apparently gives it the ability to float in midair.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Flip a number of coins equal to the total number of Pokémon in play. For each heads, you may search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Croconaw
flavorText: If it loses a fang, a new one grows back in its place. There are always 48 fangs lining its mouth.
Attack1Text: Until the end of your next turn, if an attack damages the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 20 more damage to the Defending Pokémon
Attack2Text: Until the end of your opponent's next turn, as long as Croconaw is your Active Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat, and if the effect of an attack, Pokémon Power, or Trainer card would change that player's Active Pokémon, that part of the effect does nothing.

name: Croconaw
flavorText: It opens its huge jaws wide when attacking. If it loses any fangs while biting, they grow back in.
Attack2Text: Discard the top 3 cards from your deck.

name: Electabuzz
flavorText: Electricity runs across the surface of its body. In darkness, its entire body glows a whitish-blue.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Pokémon Powers, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

name: Flaaffy
flavorText: As a result of storing too much electricity, it developed patches where even downy wool won't grow.
Attack1Text: Discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to Flaaffy in order to use this attack. Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Lightning Energy cards you discarded. This attack does 30 damage times then number of heads.
Attack2Text: Take 1 Lightning Energy cards attached to Flaaffy and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you have no Benched Pokémon, discard that Energy card.

name: Furret
flavorText: It makes a nest to suit its long and skinny body. The nest is impossible for other Pokémon to enter.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

name: Gloom
flavorText: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage and, until the end of your next turn, as long as Gloom is your Active Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat, and if the effect of an attack, Pokémon Power, or Trainer card would change that player's Active Pokémon, that part of the effect does nothing. If tails, this attack does 20 damage.

name: Granbull
flavorText: It is actually timid and easily spooked. If attacked, it flails about to fend off its attacker.
Attack2Text: This attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Granbull. Then, Granbull does 20 damage to itself.

name: Lanturn
flavorText: The light it emits is so bright that it can illuminate the sea's surface from a depth of over three miles.
Ability1Text: You may make Floodlight do 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Lanturn, but not used to pay for Floodlight's Energy cost. This power can't be used if Lanturn is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Ledian
flavorText: When the stars flicker in the night sky, Ledian flutters about, scattering a glowing powder.
Attack1Text: If you have any Grass Pokémon on your Bench, remove all Grass Energy cards from Ledian and attach them to 1 of those Pokémon, then switch Ledian with that Pokémon.

name: Magmar
flavorText: It dislikes cold places, so it blows scorching flames to make the environment suitable for itself.

name: Miltank
flavorText: Its milk is packed with nutrition, making it the ultimate beverage for the sick or weary.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. Remove 2 damage counters times the number of heads from Miltank. If it has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Noctowl
flavorText: Its eyes are specially adapted. They concentrate even faint light and enable it to see in the dark.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, look at your opponent's hand. If your opponent has any Trainer cards there, choose 1 of them. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck. This power can't be used if Noctowl is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

name: Phanpy
flavorText: It swings its long snout around playfully, but, because it is so strong, that can be dangerous.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, then if, during your opponent's next turn, Phanpy would be Knocked Out by an attack, Phanpy isn't Knocked Out and its remaining HP become 10 instead.

name: Piloswine
flavorText: Because the long hair all over its body obscures its sight, it just keeps charging repeatedly.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack. (Benching or evolving the Defending Pokémon ends this effect.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon; if tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Quagsire
flavorText: Due to its relaxed and carefree attitude, it often bumps its head on boulders and boat hulls as it swims.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Quilava
flavorText: This Pokémon is fully covered by nonflammable fur. It can withstand any kind of fire attack.
Attack1Text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Quilava in order to use this attack.
Attack2Text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them. Flip 2 coins. For each heads, this attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.)

name: Quilava
flavorText: Be careful if it turns its back during battle. It means that it will attack with the fire on its back.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokémon doesn't have a Char counter on it, flip a coin. If heads, put a Char counter on it. A Char counter requires your opponent to flip a coin after every turn. If tails, put 2 damage counters on the Pokémon with that Char counter. (Char counters stay on the Pokémon as long as it's in play.)

name: Seadra
flavorText: An examination of its cells revealed the presence of a gene not found in Horsea. It became a hot topic.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Skiploom
flavorText: The bloom on top of its head opens and closes as the temperature fluctuates up and down.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Sunflora
flavorText: It converts sunlight into energy. In the darkness after sunset, it closes its petals and becomes still.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads. Sunflora is now Confused (after doing damage).

name: Togepi
flavorText: A proverb claims that happiness will come to anyone who can make a sleeping Togepi stand up.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Xatu
flavorText: They say that it stays still and quiet because it is seeing both the past and future at the same time.
Attack1Text: Look at the top 3 cards of either player's deck and rearrange them as you like.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Chikorita
flavorText: A sweet aroma gently wafts from the leaf on its head. It is docile and loves to soak up the sun's rays.
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever Chikorita takes damage, divide that damage in half (rounded down to the nearest 10). (Any other effects still happen.)

name: Chikorita
flavorText: Its pleasantly aromatic leaf has the ability to check the humidity and temperature.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokémon attacks Chikorita during your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Chikorita is reduced by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance). (Benching or evolving either Pokémon ends this effect.)

name: Chinchou
flavorText: It shoots positive and negative electricity between the tips of its two antennae and zaps its enemies.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Chinchou.

name: Cyndaquil
flavorText: It usually stays hunched over. If it is angry or surprised, it shoots flames out of its back.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack Cyndaquil during your opponent's next turn. (Benching or evolving either Pokémon ends this effect.)
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Pokémon Powers, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

name: Cyndaquil
flavorText: It is timid and always curls itself up in a ball. If attacked, it flares up its back for protection.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard 1 Energy card attached to Cyndaquil.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

name: Girafarig
flavorText: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent and bite.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Girafarig.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Gligar
flavorText: It flies straight at its target's face, then clamps down on the startled victim to inject poison.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Hoothoot
flavorText: It always stands on one foot. It changes feet so fast that the movement can rarely be seen.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Hoppip
flavorText: To keep from being blown away by the wind, they gather in clusters. They do enjoy gentle breezes, though.
Attack2Text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon named Hoppip and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

name: Horsea
flavorText: If attacked by a larger enemy, it quickly swims to safety by adeptly controlling its dorsal fin.
Attack1Text: If an attack damaged Horsea during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage. If not, this attack does 20 damage.

name: Ledyba
flavorText: It is very timid. It's afraid to move if alone, but it's active if in a group.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Mantine
flavorText: Swimming freely in open seas, it may fly out of the water and over the waves if it builds up enough speed.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Mantine.

name: Mareep
flavorText: If static electricity builds in its body, its fleece doubles in volume. Touching it will shock you.
Attack1Text: For each Mareep in play, you may search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Mareep. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Marill
flavorText: The end of its tail serves as a buoy that keeps it from drowning, even in a vicious current.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Marill during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, Marill does 10 damage to itself.

name: Natu
flavorText: Because its wings aren't yet fully grown, it has to hop to get around. It is always staring at something.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

name: Oddish
flavorText: Awakened by moonlight, it roams actively at night. In the day it stays quietly underground.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Oddish.
Attack2Text: Remove a number of damage counters from Oddish equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Oddish has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

name: Onix
flavorText: It twists and squirms through the ground. The thunderous roar of its tunneling echoes a long way.
Attack1Text: Until the end of your next turn, if an attack damages the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 20 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Onix.

name: Pikachu
flavorText: It raises its tail to check its surroundings. The tail is sometimes struck by lightning in this pose.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Pikachu.

name: Sentret
flavorText: A very cautious Pokémon, it raises itself up using its tail to get a better view of its surroundings.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Shuckle
flavorText: The Berries it stores in its vaselike shell decompose and become a gooey liquid.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Shuckle during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Slowpoke
flavorText: It lazes vacantly near water. If something bites its tail, it won't even notice for a whole day.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Slowpoke but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

name: Snubbull
flavorText: Although it looks frightening, it is actually kind and affectionate. It is very popular.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads and if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he of she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Spinarak
flavorText: It lies still in the same pose for days in its web, waiting for its unsuspecting prey to wander close.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, until the end of your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't attack or retreat.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Stantler
flavorText: The curved antlers subtly change the flow of air to create a strange space where reality is distorted.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Sudowoodo
flavorText: Although it always pretends to be a tree, its composition appears to be closer to a rock than a plant.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Sudowoodo.

name: Sunkern
flavorText: It may drop out of the sky suddenly. If attacked by a Spearow, it violently shakes its leaves.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, you may attach up to 2 Grass Energy cards from your hand to Sunkern.
Attack2Text: Remove a number of damage counters from Sunkern equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Sunkern has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

name: Swinub
flavorText: It rubs its snout on the ground to find and dig up food. It sometimes discovers hot springs.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Totodile
flavorText: It is small but rough and tough. It won't hesitate to take a bite out of anything that moves.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Totodile.

name: Totodile
flavorText: Its well-developed jaws are powerful and capable of crushing anything. Even its trainer must be careful.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack Totodile during your opponent's next turn. (Benching or evolving either Pokémon ends this effect.)
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Wooper
flavorText: This Pokémon lives in cold water. It leaves the water to search for food when it gets cold outside.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.
